episodes.title: Logan
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: The slashing starts early in Logan – no surprise, since it's an R-rated action thriller about Wolverine, also known as Logan, the "X-Men" character with the tortured psyche and retractable claws.

episodes.title: Get Out
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: There's a terrific horror flick opening this week. Jordan Peele's debut feature scrupulously honors the genre's  conventions. Get Out never strays from the path of entertainment, yet the horrors of racism lurk in every gleefully lurid frame.

episodes.title: The Great Wall
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: There is no lack of spectacular sequences in The Great Wall. It's the most expensive movie ever produced in China, with fancy weaponry that's meant to show how technologically advanced the Inner Kingdom was.

episodes.title: The LEGO Batman Movie
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: The LEGO Batman Movie targets the familiar universe of superheroes and extravagant villains, with a subplot reminiscent of The Incredibles -- society has come to see Batman and his ilk as vigilantes who need to learn the value of teamwork.

episodes.title: The Space between Us; I Am Not Your Negro
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Sometimes movies are just plain bad, but sometimes they're distinctively bad. The Space between Us takes a delicious cake for stupidity – it's a sci-fi romance for young adults.

episodes.title: The Salesman
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Arthur Miller would have admired writer-director Asghar Farhadi's drama The Salesman for its intensity and moral depth.

episodes.title: The Founder
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Michael Keaton plays Ray Kroc, the entrepreneur who gave the world McDonald's -- and Keaton does it with panache.

episodes.title: The Crash
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: The opening frames of The Crash promise a thriller about cyber warfare...

episodes.title: A Monster Calls
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: When a monster shows up at a young boy's bedroom window one night...

episodes.title: Fences
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Denzel Washington and Viola David recreate their roles in a 2010 Broadway revival of the August Wilson play, and we're the beneficiaries.

episodes.title: La La Land
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: WEB BONUS: La La Land is a crowd-pleaser if ever there was one and Joe Morgenstern couldn't be more pleased to be part of the crowd.

episodes.title: Jackie
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: In Jackie, Natalie Portman's portrait of Jacqueline Kennedy during and immediately after JFK's assassination rises above impersonation to an eerie kind of incarnation.

episodes.title: Lion
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Joe Morgenstern says Lion in narrative form is about the randomness of adoption, but in substance it’s about the mystery of identity.

episodes.title: Manchester by the Sea
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Joe Morgenstern calls Manchester by the Sea is the best movie he's seen so far this year, "a quiet masterpiece that eggs and flows at the rhythm of life."

episodes.title: Arrival
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: We yearn to believe what Arrival has to tell us -- that life on earth isn't all there is, that we're connected to the cosmos, that time flows more mysteriously than we can fathom.

episodes.title: Loving
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Loving, a new movie by Jess Nichols about a landmark civil rights case, is new in style too -- calm, human, deeply moving -- one of the best movies of the year.

episodes.title: Fire at Sea
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern, KCRW
episodes.summary: Fire at Sea is Gianfranco Rosi's profoundly moving documentary on the migrant tides transforming our wold, and the connections in it are as revelatory as they are mysterious.

episodes.title: American Honey
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Just when you think you know what's going to happen, American Honey serves up one more surprise.

episodes.title: Queen of Katwe
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: A poor Ugandan girl's chess skills take her around the world.

episodes.title: Hell or High Water
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Hell or High Water is one of the most enjoyable films I've seen in a very long time, following two brothers on a bank-robbing spree in a desolate part of west Texas where the banks themselves are seen as robbers.

episodes.title: Florence Foster Jenkins
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: It's not exactly breaking news, but Meryl Streep is remarkable, and her latest showcase is Florence Foster Jenkins.

episodes.title: Suicide Squad
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Suicide Squad amounts to an all-out attack on the whole idea of entertainment.

episodes.title: Jason Bourne
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Jason Bourne used to be an amnesiac. Now he remember who he is, but this latest episode of the franchise forgot to make him human.

episodes.title: Star Trek Beyond
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: It looks big, with plenty of cosmic battles, but it feels smallish, a congenial adventure with familiar friends.

episodes.title: Captain Fantastic
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Captain Fantastic is a terrifically accomplished and enjoyable film about a singular household.

episodes.title: The BFG
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Spielberg uses digital wizardry to throw spectacular dreams of friendship and adventure on the big screen.

episodes.title: Hunt for the Wilderpeople
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: In Hunt for the Wilderpeople, a goofball preacher tells a tiny group of mourners that sometimes in life we may feel "like a sheep trapped in a maze designed by wolves."

episodes.title: Finding Dory
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Finding Dory can be touching, sweet and tender, but it's preposterously and terrifically funny.

episodes.title: The Music of Strangers
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Morgan Neville's documentary is a joyous revelation, a group portrait of superb musicians from all over the world offering music as an emblem of what people can do in these troubled times when they live in concert with one another.

episodes.title: The Fits
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: A wonderful little movie, The Fits opens on an 11-year old doing sit-ups -- 25 in all, hands clasped behind her head, radiant face to the camera.

episodes.title: X-Men: Apocalypse
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Enormous going on keep going on, and on, in X-Men: Apocalypse. It's a collection of explosions, eruptions and conflagrations that looks like the implosion of a franchise. This is disappointing, but also surprising.

episodes.title: Weiner
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Disgraced New York politician Anthony Weiner has been memorialized in an extraordinary documentary called...yes, Weiner.

episodes.title: Money Monster
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: In Money Monster, George Clooney plays a TV personality -- a medium-manic version of Jim Cramer, the host of NBC's Mad Money.

episodes.title: Viva
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Viva is another retelling, though a particularly affecting one, of a classic tale -- the struggle to discover and assert one's authentic identity.

episodes.title: A Hologram for the King
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: A Hologram for the King was based on the novel by Dave Eggers.

episodes.title: Sing Street
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Nine years ago American audiences discovered the Irish film Once, and took it to their hearts. The magic is back in Sing Street, a coming-of-age comedy that's also concerned with making music, and downright lovable in its evocation of young love.

episodes.title: Louder than Bombs
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Louder than Bombs is very much a movie about memory. It lives and breathes with a lovely intimacy and density of detail that we associate with fine independent features from Europe.

episodes.title: Everybody Wants Some
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Richard Linklater calls the semi-autobiographical Everybody Wants Some! a "spiritual sequel" to his 1993 Dazed and Confused.

episodes.title: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Batman v Superman is an underdeveloped, overlong and stupendously dispiriting duel of unlikely antagonists.

episodes.title: Midnight Special
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Midnight Special is a beautifully strange and stirring sci-fi adventure about a boy with special powers.

episodes.title: Marguerite
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Like lots of movies these days, Marguerite tells us that "it was inspired by a true story." That usually means the story's truth was buried beneath layers of rubbish. But the key word here is "inspired" -- the film is a wonderfully imaginative work of fiction.

episodes.title: Zootopia
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: If you're looking for joyous fun, Disney's Zootopia is Yootopia.

episodes.title: Triple 9
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: The title of Triple 9 comes from a police code, 999, that means an officer is down and urgently in need of help.

episodes.title: The Witch; Race
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: The Witch's psychodynamics may be familiar, but Robert Eggers makes them seem newly discovered with the intensity of his writing and direction.  Race is a saga of unquenchable spirit and fast-twitch muscles shot in slow-twitch style.

episodes.title: Zoolander 2
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Zoolander 2 is a dud glitter bomb...

episodes.title: Mojave
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Like the high desert that provides its main setting, Mojave is dry, often windy and full of hot air...

episodes.title: Remembering Alan Rickman
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Joe Morgenstern remembers British actor Alan Rickman, who died this week at 69. His voice made him instantly recognizable; his iconic roles and acting prowess made him memorable.

episodes.title: Anomalisa
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Anomalisa takes its title from combining "anomaly" -- something that deviates from the standard -- and Lisa, the name of the woebegone anti-heroine.

episodes.title: Star Wars: The Force Awakens
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: The Star Wars franchise has roared back with full force.

episodes.title: The Big Short
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: What gives The Big Short its surprising resonance is the breadth of its comic vision, which makes room for collateral tragedy.

episodes.title: The Lady in the Van; Youth
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: The Lady in the Van is wonderfully funny, terribly touching and a vehicle -- with comically dilapidated vehicles -- for the boundless gifts of Maggie Smith.  Like Paolo Sorrentino's previous film, The Great Beauty, Youth is full of Fellini-esque flourishes, plus glib existentialism juxtaposed with synthetic optimism.

episodes.title: The Good Dinosaur
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: In Pixar's newest feature, the Old West is a home where the dinosaurs still roam.

episodes.title: The Hunger Games: Mockingjay, Part 2
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: The Hunger Games series has come to a sporadically stirring climax with Mockingjay, Part 2.

episodes.title: By the Sea
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: WEB EXCLUSIVE: By the Sea takes place sometime during the mid-1970's in a coastal village in the south of France.

episodes.title: Spotlight
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Spotlight is the year's best movie so far, and a rarity among all those dramatizations that claim to be based on actual events. Remarkably, the movie and its flawless ensemble cast have captured their subject in all its richness and complexity.

episodes.title: Our Brand Is Crisis
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Our Brand Is Crisis is meant to be a fictional version of Rachel Boynton's 2005 documentary of the same name...

episodes.title: Nasty Baby; Rock the Kasbah
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Nasty Baby is alive with random energy that sets up a surprise ending without blowing the surprise. Rock the Kasbah is a two-bit Ishtar that might play better on a phone.

episodes.title: Room
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Although its derivations are anything but poetic -- notorious cases of real-life imprisonment and abuse, Room is as beautifully wrought as any film that's come our way in a very long while.

episodes.title: The Martian
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Knowing the premise of The Martian won't prepare you for the remarkable variety and complexity of Ridley Scott's sci-fi extravaganza.

episodes.title: 99 Homes
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: 99 Homes is a relatively small, tough-minded drama about pitiless people doing unprincipled things. And it turns out to be one of the most interesting, elegantly crafted and improbably entertaining films to come along in quite a while.

episodes.title: Black Mass
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Johnny Depp creates a seethingly evil portrait of James "Whitey" Bulger, one of the pre-eminent -- and pre-eminently violent -- criminals of recent times.

episodes.title: A Taste of Telluride
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Just back from the Telluride Film Festival, Joe Morgenstern introduces us to a couple of stand-outs.

episodes.title: Z for Zachariah
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: In Z for Zachariah the post-apocalyptic thriller gets a renovation, if not re-invention -- as a love triangle in a valley that has somehow been spared from whatever it was that brought an end to civilization.

episodes.title: Top Spin
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Top Spin starts ultra-slowly, then picks up speed. The subject of this documentary is table tennis  -- or ping pong, for those of us who play it just for fun.

episodes.title: Straight Outta Compton
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Straight Outta Compton is notable for its omissions as well as its strengths, but that shouldn't be surprising.

episodes.title: The Gift
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: One of the many gifts conferred by the new movie The Gift is the pleasure of feeling like putty in the hands of a first-rate storyteller.

episodes.title: Best of Enemies
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Best of Enemies is a must-view film for our media-besotted age, a serious film about a serious failure to communicate ideas.

episodes.title: Southpaw
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Southpaw stars Jake Gyllenhaal as a boxer in desperate need of redemption.

episodes.title: Trainwreck
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: American comedy doesn't get much better than Trainwreck at its best. Amy Schumer is a fearless artist without borders.

episodes.title: Minions
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Minions are mischievous sidekicks who keep getting into trouble of their own making.

episodes.title: Amy
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Amy Winehouse was unlucky and unwise in life, but her story fell into the right hands after she died.

episodes.title: Ted 2
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Seth MacFarlane's raunch-rich comedy is a sequel to his 2012 hit about an amiable guy from Boston and the foul-mouthed womanizer of a teddy bear who's been his best friend since childhood.

episodes.title: Inside Out
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Actors use their faces, voices and bodies to convey what their characters are feeling, but the new Pixar film Inside Out takes a more direct approach.

episodes.title: Me and Earl and the Dying Girl
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Me and Earl and the Dying Girl is a fresh take on contemporary adolescence as a journey from ironic detachment to open-hearted feeling.

episodes.title: Entourage
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Charm has curdled into smarm in the big-screen version of Entourage.

episodes.title: Tomorrowland
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Can we fix our troubled world, or not?

episodes.title: Mad Max: Fury Road
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: George Miller, whose Mad Max gave the movie medium a new genre almost four decades ago, is back with Mad Max: Fury Road.

episodes.title: Unfriended
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Unfriended is a micro-budget horror film played out entirely one high school girl's laptop.

episodes.title: Ex Machina
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Alex Garland's Ex Machina is an elegant sci-fi fantasy about artificial intelligence.

episodes.title: White God
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Cute dogs doing cute tricks have become stars of the social networks, but White God offers a different take on man's best friend.

episodes.title: Cinderella
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Call it bias if you choose, but any Cinderella with Cate Blanchett as the wicked stepmother couldn't be bad.

episodes.title: Merchants of Doubt; An Honest Liar
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: In its advocacy of skeptical thinking, An Honest Liar dovetails neatly, if accidentally, with Merchants of Doubt.

episodes.title: Queen and Country
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Queen and Country, the sequel to Hope and Glory that took John Boorman almost three decades to make, is worth the wait.

episodes.title: What We Do in the Shadows
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Marketing campaigns can bring movie goers into theaters to see what the fuss is all about, but they can't generate the excitement of those rare occasions when audiences discover a movie on their own. A charming curiosity from New Zealand. One more riff on mythical bloodsuckers.

episodes.title: 50 Shades of Grey
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Reasonable minds may differ on what the playroom is all about in 50 Shades of Grey.

episodes.title: Jupiter Ascending
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: In a momentous conjunction of events, Jupiter Ascending -- the mega-budget sci-fi extravaganza -- is opening around the nation and the world on the very day that Jupiter, the mega-planet, is at its annual opposition to Earth.

episodes.title: Timbuktu
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Timbuktu takes a deadly aim at Islamic fundamentalism by playing its own game of deft ridicule.

episodes.title: Red Army
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: The opening of Red Army is good news if you're a hockey fan, a history buff or just an admirer of first-rate documentaries.

episodes.title: Paddington
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Paddington is the comic chronicle of a Peruvian bear's adventures in London, and it turns out to be a total charmer...

episodes.title: The Interview
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: How did such a turkey ever escape the studio lot?

episodes.title: Top Five
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: A pyrotechnic pinwheel of a personal comedy.

episodes.title: Wild
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Reese Witherspoon is the angry, wounded soul of Wild. She commands the screen throughout her heroine's 1,100-mile journey of self-discovery and self-repair, on foot and mostly alone, from the Mojave desert to northern Oregon along the Pacific Crest Trail.

episodes.title: The Imitation Game
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: The Imitation Game, with Benedict Cumberbatch in full cry, summons up a life that changed modern history.

episodes.title: The Hunger Games: Mockingjay, Part 1
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: The Hunger Games: Mockingjay, Part 1 is a rare bird in its genre, an action adventure with an interesting mind and a resonant spirit.

episodes.title: Foxcatcher
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Foxcatcher is an enthralling enigma of a movie.

episodes.title: Interstellar
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Joe Morgenstern reviews Christopher Nolan's 168-minute odyssey through the space-time continuum...

episodes.title: Nightcrawler
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Dan Gilroy's Nightcrawler is a dark dream of a thriller.

episodes.title: Gone Girl
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Rather than let nuance intrude, Gone Girl doubles down on perversity, and its stars follow suit.

episodes.title: The Skeleton Twins
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Two luminaries of Saturday Night Live are reunited in The Skeleton Twins — Kristen Wiig and Bill Hader. It’s hard to say if they give wonderful comic performances with a tragic dimension, or wonderful dramatic performances with a comic dimension.

episodes.title: Telluride Film Festival
episodes.author: KCRW, Joe Morgenstern
episodes.summary: Joe Morgenstern reviews the new Pixar short Lava, as well as Birdman, Leviathan, and Mr. Turner from the Telluride Film Festival.
